abstract: Florida legalizes same-sex marriage, despite fact that only six years earlier state passed constitutional amendment banning it; is 36th state to make gay marriage legal.
lead_paragraph: Only six years ago, Florida passed a constitutional amendment ban on gay marriage, garnering 62 percent of the vote.

byline.contributor: Lizette Alvarez reported from Miami, and Nila Do Simon from Fort Lauderdale, Fla.
byline.original: By LIZETTE ALVAREZ and NILA DO SIMON

snippet: Only six years ago, Florida passed a constitutional amendment ban on gay marriage, garnering 62 percent of the vote.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject

headline.main: Same-Sex Pairs in Florida Say Jubilant ‘I Dos’
headline.print_headline: Same-Sex Couples in Florida Exchange Jubilant ‘I Dos’
